required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chemotherapy-related Cognitive Impairment and Acute Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Chemotherapy-related Cognitive Impairment in Adults With Acute Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is an ancillary study of an intervention study (NCT04570709). The parent study is a single institution, feasibility trial of 20 (10 control and 10 intervention) patients with the primary objective of assessing feasibility, acceptability, and change in pre and post measures of symptoms, function, and quality of life by administering the Palliative and Collaborative Care In Tervention (PACT). We will further assess cognitive function in the patients who participate in the parent study.

detailed_description.textblock: The study objective is to observe patient-reported and researcher-assessed cognitive function in adults with acute myeloid leukemia with chemotherapy treatment. We will assess cognitive function using a battery of neuropsychological assessments, patient-reported questionnaire, and semi-structured interviews among participants in both control and intervention groups. The group assignment will be conducted through parent study (NCT04570709). Participating in this study will not affect participants' group assignment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is an ancillary study of an intervention study. Group assignment is based on the parent study protocol (NCT04570709).

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function as assessed by Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Cognitive Function
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)
primary_outcome.description: The questionnaire consists of 4 domains, including perceived cognitive impairments, comments from others, perceived cognitive abilities, and impact of quality of life. The higher the score, the better the cognitive function.

primary_outcome.measure: Processing speed and executive function as assessed by Trial Making Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)
primary_outcome.description: Include both trails A and B.

primary_outcome.measure: Memory and verbal learning as assessed by Hopkins Verbal Learning Test-revised (HVLT-R)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)
primary_outcome.description: Include total recall and delayed recall.

primary_outcome.measure: Speeded lexical fluency as assessed by Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System (D-KEFS) letter fluency
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)
primary_outcome.description: Include three initial alphabet letter for each assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Attention and working memory as assessed by Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS)-digit span
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive effort as assessed by Borg CR 10
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the second cycle of treatment (about day 30)
primary_outcome.description: Range from 0-10, maximum. The higher the score, the much the cognitive effort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function as assessed by Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Cognitive Function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 60, 90, 120, 150, and 180)
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire consists of 4 domains, including perceived cognitive impairments, comments from others, perceived cognitive abilities, and impact of quality of life. The higher the score, the better the cognitive function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Processing speed and executive function as assessed by Trial Making Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, fourth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 90 and 180)
secondary_outcome.description: Include both trails A and B.

secondary_outcome.measure: Memory and verbal learning as assessed by Hopkins Verbal Learning Test-revised (HVLT-R)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, fourth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 90 and 180)
secondary_outcome.description: Include total recall and delayed recall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Speeded lexical fluency as assessed by Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System (D-KEFS) letter fluency
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, fourth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 90 and 180)
secondary_outcome.description: Include three initial alphabet letter for each assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention and working memory as assessed by Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS)-digit span
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, fourth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 90 and 180)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive effort as assessed by Borg CR 10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first, fourth, and seventh cycle of treatment (baseline, about day 90 and 180)
secondary_outcome.description: Range from 0-10, maximum. The higher the score, the much the cognitive effort.

arm_group.description: Patients in the control arm will receive standard of care.
This ancillary study does not include intervention development component. The detail intervention can be found in the parent study protocol (NCT04570709).

intervention.description: This ancillary study does not include intervention development component. The detail intervention can be found in the parent study protocol (NCT04570709).

criteria.textblock:
[Patient]
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 60 years of age
- diagnosis of AML
- Receive 1) low-dose cytarabine or hypomethylating agent (HMA) in combination with Venetoclax chemotherapy OR 2) low-dose cytarabine or hypomethylating agent (HMA) in combination with Venetoclax chemotherapy and any investigational drugs
- have caregiver(s) willing to participate
- participate in the parent study (PACT study, NCT04570709)
Exclusion Criteria:
- referred to hospice care
[Caregiver]
Inclusion criteria:
- identified by patient as a caregiver
- ≥18 years of age
- speak and read English

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina Lineberger Comprehenisive Cancer Center
